page.title: 07FARMING - ANIMALS
page.content: The majority of{sheep}grazed in this area are Mule/Suffolk cross, bred to produce good mothers, highly prolific breeders, and a reasonable carcass when the lambs are killed for meat for human consumption. A flock of pure bred Dorset Down is also kept in this area. The{beef cattle}are mainly animals that have come out of the dairy herd when no replacements are needed (both male and female). The majority are cross breeds, bred from Hereford, Charolais, and other bulls to produce a good carcass and to suit the required feeding system. There is an intensive system{pig}unit on the high ground. The pigs are housed for their entire life in covered and semi-covered buildings; fattened and sold for meat for human consumption.
